column4: njal yeah that looks like the one can you help me through that, sorry if im being stupid im fairly new to all this
I can try
Ok, so download the second driver
Install driver and point it to the driver exe file
I know it wants an inf, but the driver came packaged as a exe, i don't know how to open it
Unless....you install it in windows and then copy the inf file over onto your linux machine
Let me know how it goes
Follow zaraphaths idea first
Cool, is it working?
try sudo modprobe ndiswrapper
No worries
Now
run sudo gedit /etc/modules
Add ndiswrapper at the end of the file, this should tell the system to run ndiswrapper at boot
The ultimate test is to reboot without the network cable in, then telling me after the reboot
Hmm
Did you run modprobe when you logged in?
Remove the ndiswrapper entry from /etc/modules reboot and then run the modprobe command, this will see if ndiswrapper is having problems at boot, erm no, i doubt it
Did you run modprobe after you logged in, or did it just work?
reboot a couple of more times, just to make sure it's not a fluke then i would be happy
That's what i would do
